main event: On July 7, 1952, multiple witnesses, including two police officers, reported seeing unidentified bright objects in the sky over New York City that exhibited rapid movements and abrupt changes in direction.
interesting points: The objects were described as much brighter than any stars or planes., Observers included civilians and law enforcement officers who confirmed the strange behavior of the lights., The sighting lasted approximately 30 seconds and was reported from various locations in the city., There were attempts to capture photographs, but many witnesses failed in their attempts., There was no sound associated with the sighting and no conventional aircraft identified.
witness description: Civilian witnesses, police officers, and local residents
